main.name: Kai-Wei Wang
main.description: Software Engineer | World Traveller | Boba Connoisseur
main.bio: My Name is Kai-Wei Wang, but my friends call me Konrad. I'm a 3rd year Computer Science student at Georgia Tech and I love everything about this field, from intense sleep deprived hackathons to developing impactful projects.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.specialization: Human Computer Interactions, Graphics, UI/UX, Data Visualization, Machine Learning

education.description: Delegate in Model United Nations, Instructor at Coding club, Varsity Basketball

work.title: Software Development Intern
work.team: Web development team: Location-based social search application
work.d1: Developed modular front-end and back-end applications using HTML, CSS, ReactJS, AJAX, NodeJS and deployed working application for pride month in June 2018 with 40million DAU
work.d2: Worked closely with members of the product development team to achieve the best user experience while writing modular and scalable code
work.d3: Worked using Git and deployed with GitLab (CI/CD continuous integration); coordinated with Agile process

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.team: Artificial Intelligence & Exploratory Team: Visually Similar object detection tool
work.d1: Built image classifiers with CNN using TensorFlow and categorized Home Depot’s product image database
work.d2: Implemented machine learning algorithms such as KNN, SVM and pretrained neural networks with Keras VGG16 on ImageNet for image classifications
work.d3: Improved object detection accuracy through implementing triplet loss on pretrained models for different product categories

research.name: Georgia Tech Interactive Media Technology
research.title: Research Assistant
research.team: Ambient Alerting (Aware Home), Supervisor: Prof. Brian Jones
research.d1: Explored applications of intelligent voice assistant with python and AWS lambda and Developed applications to deliver notifications of alerts, status, and setup with Android Studio and SQL
research.d2: Deployed sensors around home with Arduino and recorded user activity for research

research.name: Georgia Tech Augmented Environments Lab
research.title: UI/UX developer
research.team: Community AR design (Invisible Cities), Supervisor: Dr. Jay Bolter
research.d1: Produced AR experience in which multiple users can place AR entities in physical space in real-time which are programmed through JavaScript, Unity and C#
research.d2: Developed front-end design and performed UI/UX research

research.name: Georgia Tech STIP institute
research.title: Research Assistant
research.team: STEM Research Communities & Knowledge Transfer, Supervisor: Dr. Jan Youtie & Dr. Alan Porter
research.d1: Used longitudinal, cross-sectional, and comparative research designs through Vantage Point to generate analyses of large samples of research literature in ‘STEM-ED’ and ‘Cog-Sci’ research communities
research.d2: Designed and implanted applications that scrape through Web of Science database with Python

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust
projects.category: My Travel Blog for my post-university travels

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear
projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Original Thai Food
projects.category: Website I built for a restaurant I like in Thailand

projects.title: Resume Website

projects.title: Smirkspace
projects.category: (MVP Only) A React and Meteor based chat University project.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
